ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This class is perfect for a student who wishes to learn more on ancient diets. Discovering new physical and archaeometric technics, these weeks of seminar will show how to approach the question and improve our knowledge on the question by using our own experience. As food and drinks are the basis of human needs, by taking this class we can see better how the people of the past act in the same way we live today.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: By learning how to question the archaeological material for understanding consumptions variations in time, this course and the final paper has brought me awareness on small factors which I did not know of before taking this class.On my own site in Uzbekistan and Dunhuang, I hope to have a chance of using the starch grain analysis which would bring new knowledge to already well studied material. This class was for me a door to a new path and innovation in the field.
